CreateInstance.document: This API is used to create an ES cluster instance with the specified specification.
CreateInstance.name: Creates an ES cluster instance

DeleteInstance.document: This API is used to terminate a cluster instance.
DeleteInstance.name: Terminates an ES cluster instance

DescribeInstanceLogs.document: This API is used to query eligible ES cluster logs in the current region under the current account.
DescribeInstanceLogs.name: Queries ES cluster logs

DescribeInstanceOperations.document: This API is used to query the operation record of an instance according to the specified criteria.
DescribeInstanceOperations.name: Queries instance operation record

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to query all eligible instances in the current region under the current account.
DescribeInstances.name: Queries ES cluster instances

RestartInstance.document: This API is used to restart an ES cluster instance (for operations such as system update).
RestartInstance.name: Restarts an ES cluster instance

UpdateInstance.document:
This API is used for operations such as scaling a cluster, renaming an instance, modifying configuration, resetting password, and setting Kibana blacklist/whitelist. InstanceId is required, while ForceRestart is optional. Other parameters or parameter combinations and their meanings are as follows:
- InstanceName: Renames an instance (only for instance identification)
- NodeNum: Horizontally scales a cluster by adding or removing node
- NodeType, DiskSize: Vertically scales a data node in a cluster
- MasterNodeNum: Horizontally scales a cluster by adding or removing dedicated master nodes
- MasterNodeType, MasterNodeDiskSize: Vertically scales a dedicated master node in a cluster
- EsConfig: Modifies cluster configuration
- Password: Changes the password of the default user “elastic”
- EsAcl: Modifies the ACL
- CosBackUp: Sets auto-backup to COS for a cluster
Only one of the parameters or parameter combinations above can be passed in at a time, and passing fewer or more will cause the request to fail.
UpdateInstance.name: Updates an ES cluster instance

UpgradeInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade ES cluster version
UpgradeInstance.name: Upgrades ES cluster version

UpgradeLicense.document: This API is used to upgrade ES X-Pack.
UpgradeLicense.name: Upgrades ES X-Pack

FailedOperation.NoPayment.document: No credit card or PayPal account is linked to the current account. Unable to make a payment.

CreateInstance.document: Creates an ES cluster instance based on the input parameters
CreateInstance.title: Creating an ES Cluster Instance

DeleteInstance.document: Delete a cluster instance with the specified ID
DeleteInstance.title: Deleting an ES Cluster Instance

DescribeInstanceLogs.document: Query the latest master logs of a cluster
DescribeInstanceLogs.title: Querying ES Cluster Logs

DescribeInstanceOperations.title: Querying the Operation Record of an ES Cluster Instance

DescribeInstances.document: Query eligible ES cluster instances according to the given criteria and return their details
DescribeInstances.title: Querying ES Cluster Instances

RestartInstance.document: Perform operations such as system update
RestartInstance.title: Restarting an ES Cluster Instance

UpdateInstance.document: Rename the specified ES cluster instance
UpdateInstance.title: Renaming an ES Cluster Instance

UpdateInstance.document: Horizontally scale the specified ES cluster instance (only horizontal scaling is supported currently)
UpdateInstance.title: Horizontally Scaling an ES Cluster

UpdateInstance.document: Modify the configuration of the specified ES cluster instance
UpdateInstance.title: Modifying ES Cluster Instance Configuration

UpdateInstance.document: Reset the Kibana password of the specified ES cluster instance
UpdateInstance.title: Resetting Kibana Password

UpdateInstance.document: Set the Kibana access blacklist/whitelist for the specified ES cluster instance
UpdateInstance.title: Setting Kibana Access Blacklist/Whitelist

UpdateInstance.document: Vertically scale the node specification (number of cores and memory size) and disk size in a cluster (only vertical scaling is supported currently)
UpdateInstance.title: Vertically Scaling an ES Cluster
Setting Auto-backup to COS for ES

members.document: Whether to enable auto-backup to COS
members.name: IsAutoBackup

members.document: Auto-backup time (accurate down to the hour), such as "22:00"
members.name: BackupTime

members.document:
Node specification
  • ES.S1.SMALL2: 1-core 2 GB
  • ES.S1.MEDIUM4: 2-core 4 GB
  • ES.S1.MEDIUM8: 2-core 8 GB
  • ES.S1.LARGE16: 4-core 16 GB
  • ES.S1.2XLARGE32: 8-core 32 GB
  • ES.S1.4XLARGE32: 16-core 32 GB
  • ES.S1.4XLARGE64: 16-core 64 GB
members.name: NodeType

members.document: Access password, which must contain 8 to 16 characters, and include at least two of the following three types of characters: [a-z,A-Z], [0-9] and [-!@#$%&^*+=_:;,.?]
members.name: Password

members.document: Instance name, which can contain 1 to 50 English letters, Chinese characters, digits, dashes (-), or underscores (_)
members.name: InstanceName

members.document:
Billing method
  • PREPAID: Monthly subscription
  • POSTPAID_BY_HOUR: Pay-as-you-go on an hourly basis
    • Default value: POSTPAID_BY_HOUR
members.name: ChargeType

members.document: Purchased duration for monthly subscription (in the unit determined by the TimeUnit parameter)
members.name: ChargePeriod

members.document:
Auto-renewal flag
  • RENEW_FLAG_AUTO: Auto-renewal enabled
  • RENEW_FLAG_MANUAL: Auto-renewal disabled
    • This parameter has to be set if `ChargeType` is PREPAID. If it is not passed in, auto-renewal is disabled for regular users and enabled for SVIP users by default
members.name: RenewFlag

members.document:
Node disk type
  • CLOUD_SSD: SSD cloud disk
  • CLOUD_PREMIUM: Premium cloud disk
    • Default value: CLOUD_SSD
members.name: DiskType

members.document: Billing duration unit, which has to be set if `ChargeType` is PREPAID. The default value is "m" (month), and only "m" is supported currently
members.name: TimeUnit

members.document:
Whether to automatically use vouchers
  • 0: No
  • 1: Yes
    • Default value: 0
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: List of voucher IDs (only one voucher can be specified at a time currently)
members.name: VoucherIds

members.document:
Whether to create a dedicated master node
  • true: Yes
  • false: No
    • Default value: false
members.name: EnableDedicatedMaster

members.document: Number of dedicated master nodes (only 3 and 5 are supported. This value must be passed in if `EnableDedicatedMaster` is true)
members.name: MasterNodeNum

members.document:
Dedicated master node type, which must be passed in if `EnableDedicatedMaster` is true
  • ES.S1.SMALL2: 1-core 2 GB
  • ES.S1.MEDIUM4: 2-core 4 GB
  • ES.S1.MEDIUM8: 2-core 8 GB
  • ES.S1.LARGE16: 4-core 16 GB
  • ES.S1.2XLARGE32: 8-core 32 GB
  • ES.S1.4XLARGE32: 16-core 32 GB
  • ES.S1.4XLARGE64: 16-core 64 GB
members.name: MasterNodeType

members.document: Dedicated master node disk size in GB, which is optional. If passed in, it can only be 50 and cannot be customized currently
members.name: MasterNodeDiskSize

members.document: ClusterName in the cluster configuration file, which is the instance ID by default and currently cannot be customized
members.name: ClusterNameInConf

members.document:
Cluster deployment mode
  • 0: single-AZ deployment
  • 1: multi-AZ deployment
    • Default value: 0
members.name: DeployMode

members.document: Details of AZs in multi-AZ deployment mode (which is required when DeployMode is 1)
members.name: MultiZoneInfo

members.document:
License type
  • oss: Open Source Edition
  • basic: Basic Edition
  • platinum: Platinum Edition
    • Default value: Platinum
members.name: LicenseType

members.document: Unique ID of the request. Each request returns a unique ID. The RequestId is required to troubleshoot issues.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Unique ID of the request. Each request returns a unique ID. The RequestId is required to troubleshoot issues.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Log type. Default value: 1
  • 1: master log
  • 2: search slow log
  • 3: index slow log
  • 4: GC log
members.name: LogType

members.document: Search keyword, which supports LUCENE syntax, such as level:WARN, ip:1.1.1.1, and message:test-index
members.name: SearchKey

members.document: Log start time in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, such as 2019-01-22 20:15:53
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Log end time in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, such as 2019-01-22 20:15:53
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Number of entries per page. Default value: 100. Maximum value: 100
members.name: Limit

members.document:
Time sorting order. Default value: 0
  • 0: descending
  • 1: ascending
members.name: OrderByType

members.document: Unique ID of the request. Each request returns a unique ID. The RequestId is required to troubleshoot issues.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Unique ID of the request. Each request returns a unique ID. The RequestId is required to troubleshoot issues.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: AZ of the cluster instance. If this is not passed in, all AZs are used by default
members.name: Zone

members.document: Number of entries per page. Default value: 20
members.name: Limit

members.document:
Sort by field
  • 1: instance ID
  • 2: instance name
  • 3: AZ
  • 4: creation time
    • If `orderKey` is not passed in, sort by creation time in descending order
members.name: OrderByKey

members.document:
Sorting order
  • 0: ascending
  • 1: descending
    • If orderByKey is passed in but orderByType is not, ascending order is used by default
members.name: OrderByType

members.document: Unique ID of the request. Each request returns a unique ID. The RequestId is required to troubleshoot issues.
members.name: RequestId

DictInfo.document: Information of the IK plugin dictionary

members.document: UID of the VPC where the instance resides
members.name: VpcUid

members.document: UID of the subnet where the instance resides
members.name: SubnetUid

members.document: Instance status. 0: processing; 1: normal; -1: stopped; -2: terminating; -3: terminated
members.name: Status

members.document: Instance billing mode. Value range: PREPAID: Monthly subscription; POSTPAID_BY_HOUR: Pay-as-you-go on an hourly basis; CDHPAID: Billed based on CDH, i.e., only CDH is billed but not the instances on CDH
members.name: ChargeType

members.document: Purchased duration for monthly subscription in months
members.name: ChargePeriod

members.document: Auto-renewal flag. Value range: NOTIFY_AND_AUTO_RENEW: Notify of expiry and auto-renew; NOTIFY_AND_MANUAL_RENEW: Notify of expiry but do not auto-renew; DISABLE_NOTIFY_AND_MANUAL_RENEW: Do not notify of expiry or auto-renew. Default value: NOTIFY_AND_AUTO_RENEW. If this parameter is specified as NOTIFY_AND_AUTO_RENEW, the instance will be auto-renewed on a monthly basis upon expiry if account balance is sufficient.
members.name: RenewFlag

members.document:
Node specification
  • ES.S1.SMALL2: 1-core 2 GB
  • ES.S1.MEDIUM4: 2-core 4 GB
